p.s: To express the relationship between Macbeth and his wife and to show how she convinces her husband, the author uses difficult elements of narrative style and manner.
The accumulation of questions in the three short sentences of Macbeth and his wife (ll. 1 ff.) shows that they are both under pressure and know what is at the brink.
His business: He hath honoured me of late (...) in their newest gloss(ll. 4 ff.) is a flashback and reversrefers back to the moment where Duncan granted Macbeth the title Thane of Cawdor.
It should express that Macbeth gained some influence already and that he has no ambition to betray King Duncan because if something went wrong, he will lose everything.
The personification hope drunk (ll. 9) shows that Lady Macbeth really believed that Macbeth will take that chance and that she is upset about his siedsight on the situation.
The metaphor of the poor cat i'the adage (ll. 19) is used by her to show her husband that he behaves like a coward who will not take a rishwish to gain improvements of his life.
The alliteration Prithee peace (ll. 21f.) showshows the attempt of Macbeth to stop the conversation with his wife, because he will not think about it anymore.
What beast was't then, that made you break this enterprise to me?(ll. 23f.) is a reference to the Chain of Being.
Lady Macbeth feels betrayed by her husband because he will not take the chance to gain power and improve their lives.

The alliteration much more the man (ll. 27) should express how strong Macbeth could appeareappear and the imagery of her killing a baby for Macbeth because she swears it to him (ll. 30 ff.) is used by her to appeal to MacbethsMacbeth's loyalty to his wife.
At this point Macbeth starts to think about the possibilities again, even if his short question If we should fail? (ll. 36) shows that he is still insecure.

Screw your courage to the sticking-place and we'll not fail(ll. 38 f.) builds up pressure on Macbeth, because this metaphor expresses that the outgoing of the plan to kill Duncan depends on MacbethsMacbeth's behave.
The alliteration Will I with wine and wassail (ll. 42) shows that Lady Macbeth is already determined to fullfillfulfill the plan she creates.

The rethoricalrhetorical question What cannot you and I perform upon the unguarded Duncan? should express again, that they have the perfect chance to make the prophecy of the three witches true, that he will be the new King.
The alliteration fake face (ll. 57) is the last comment of Macbeth to the plan and shows that he will follow his wife but feels not comfortable and insecure with the whole situation.
All in all the scene shows that Lady Macbeth is much more self-confident and also superior in front of her husband Macbeth and that she is responsible for the killing of Duncan.
That can easily be noticed by her long statements and only short interventions by Macbeth.
The author uses rethroricalrhetorical devices to enforce this effect.
